entry.title: Subrosa - Why Trust Is Not an Option
entry.content: Check out Subrosa: “Subrosa is an encrypted communication platform. Reclaim your privacy and talk freely.” Hell no. Read my other post about JS crypto. Besides, the owners could always backdoor the JS code. I won’t have the nerves to always SHA512 their JS and my cache files, then diff to find the leaky hole. I’m no fucking Robin Seggelmann; I don’t have finesse. So, stick with Pidgin + OTR, please.
